conclusion: Block P has mass m and Block Q has mass 4m.
Initial velocity of P is v_0 up the incline and initial velocity of Q is 0 (at rest).
Coefficient of kinetic friction between Q and incline is tanθ.
No friction between P and incline.
Collision between P and Q is elastic.
Blocks can be treated as point masses.
Set up the elastic collision equations using conservation of momentum: m v_0 = m v_{P_1} + 4m v_{Q_1}.
Set up the elastic collision equations using conservation of kinetic energy: v_0^2 = v_{P_1}^2 + 4v_{Q_1}^2.
Use the relative velocity approach for elastic collisions: v_{P_1} - v_{Q_1} = -v_0.
Solve the system of equations to find v_{Q_1} = 2v_0/5.
Verify using Equation 2: v_0^2 = v_{P_1}^2 + 4v_{Q_1}^2, which checks out.
The magnitudes of the velocities of P and Q immediately after the first collision are v_{P_1} = 3v_0/5 and v_{Q_1} = 2v_0/5.
